Notes on SSSE: Efficiently Erasing Samples From Trained Machine Learning Models http://localhost:1313/posts/papers/ssse-efficiently-erasing-samples-from-trained-machine-learning-models/ Wed, 10 Apr 2024 12:20:47 +0200 <<<<<<< HEAD http://localhost:1313/posts/papers/ssse-efficiently-erasing-samples-from-trained-machine-learning-models/ =======
https://alex-pv01.github.io/posts/papers/ssse-efficiently-erasing-samples-from-trained-machine-learning-models/ >>>>>>> 3e41910ec3b37fbf49862f5d6edb1c57ce5467db Disclaimer: This is part of my notes on AI research papers. I do this to learn and communicate what I understand. Feel free to comment if you have any suggestion, that would be very much appreciated. The following post is a comment on the paper SSSE: Efficiently Erasing Samples From Trained Machine Learning Models by Alexandra Peste, Dan Alistarh, and Christoph H. Lampert. Peste et. al. propose Single-Step Sample Erasure (SSSE), a method to efficiently and effectively erase samples from trained machine learning models.
